DataElement.preferredName: Biospecimen Tissue Collection And Processing Standard Operating Procedure Adjacent Tissue Variation Comments Text
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The description of deviations that occurred in processing normal adjacent tissue specimens from the BPV biospecimen tissue collection and processing standard operating procedure.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Biospecimen Fixed Specimen Paraffin Embedded Normal Adjacent Tissue Biospecimen Pre-analytical Variables Program Standard Operating Procedure Process
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Any material sample taken from a biological entity for testing, diagnostic, propagation, treatment or research purposes, including a sample obtained from a living organism or taken from the biological object after halting of all its life functions. Biospecimen can contain one or more components including but not limited to cellular molecules, cells, tissues, organs, body fluids, embryos, and body excretory products._Tissue which is preserved in a fixative solution, usually formalin._Tissue that is preserved and embedded in paraffin._Being approximately average or within certain limits; conforming with or constituting a norm or standard or level or type or social norm._Next to or adjoining._An anatomical structure consisting of similarly specialized cells and intercellular matrix, aggregated according to genetically determined spatial relationships, performing a specific function._A program designed to systematically investigate the effects of individual pre-analytical factors on the molecular profiles of biospecimens. The results of this study will be used to develop evidence-based protocols and best practices for optimal collection, processing, and storage of biospecimens._An established procedure to be followed in carrying out a given operation or in a given situation._A sequence of events which produces some outcome.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Any material sample taken from a biological entity for testing, diagnostic, propagation, treatment or research purposes, including a sample obtained from a living organism or taken from the biological object after halting of all its life functions. Biospecimen can contain one or more components including but not limited to cellular molecules, cells, tissues, organs, body fluids, embryos, and body excretory products.

Concepts.definition: Any material sample taken from a biological entity for testing, diagnostic, propagation, treatment or research purposes, including a sample obtained from a living organism or taken from the biological object after halting of all its life functions. Biospecimen can contain one or more components including but not limited to cellular molecules, cells, tissues, organs, body fluids, embryos, and body excretory products.

Property.preferredName: Fixed Specimen Paraffin Embedded Tissue Normal Adjacent Tissue Biospecimen Pre-analytical Variables Program Standard Operating Procedure Process
Property.preferredDefinition: Tissue which is preserved in a fixative solution, usually formalin.:Tissue that is preserved and embedded in paraffin.:Being approximately average or within certain limits; conforming with or constituting a norm or standard or level or type or social norm.:Next to or adjoining.:An anatomical structure consisting of similarly specialized cells and intercellular matrix, aggregated according to genetically determined spatial relationships, performing a specific function.:A program designed to systematically investigate the effects of individual pre-analytical factors on the molecular profiles of biospecimens. The results of this study will be used to develop evidence-based protocols and best practices for optimal collection, processing, and storage of biospecimens.:An established procedure to be followed in carrying out a given operation or in a given situation.:A sequence of events which produces some outcome.

Concepts.definition: Tissue which is preserved in a fixative solution, usually formalin.
Tissue that is preserved and embedded in paraffin.
Being approximately average or within certain limits; conforming with or constituting a norm or standard or level or type or social norm.
An anatomical structure consisting of similarly specialized cells and intercellular matrix, aggregated according to genetically determined spatial relationships, performing a specific function.

A program designed to systematically investigate the effects of individual pre-analytical factors on the molecular profiles of biospecimens. The results of this study will be used to develop evidence-based protocols and best practices for optimal collection, processing, and storage of biospecimens.
An established procedure to be followed in carrying out a given operation or in a given situation.
A sequence of events which produces some outcome.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: attributes of a patient's laboratory sample, including the source, condition, and fixative.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The free text field for general notes.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the management of a research protocol and its case report forms.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Text; the words of something written.
